cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 171 (Wednesday, October 18, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. TONY GONZALES of Texas:H.R. 5981.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:This legislation prohibits any federal funding to be usedto support drag theater performances.[Page H5029]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

cdata.text: This bill prohibits using federal funds for programs or activities that involve hosting or supporting drag shows or performances.

bill.title: To prohibit the use of Federal funds to be used to support drag theater performances.

item.title: To prohibit the use of Federal funds to be used to support drag theater performances.
To prohibit the use of Federal funds to be used to support drag theater performances.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
